title: 蘋果重返中國手機市占第一！iPhone出貨暴增28%、華為小米出貨量衰退
text: 市調機構 Counterpoint Research 最新數據顯示，儘管關鍵記憶體晶片短缺情況持續惡化，蘋果 ( AAPL-US ) 仍在聖誕假期季度憑藉 iPhone 出貨量年增 28%，成功重返中國智慧手機市場市占龍頭。 根據《彭博》報導，Counterpoint 指出，iPhone 17 系列強力吸引消費者，使蘋果手機在 12 月當季的出貨占比達到五分之一。 這波成長主要來自競爭對手市占下滑，華為與小米 ( 01810-HK ) 的出貨量皆出現雙位數百分比衰退。 與此同時，整體中國智慧手機市場需求仍顯疲弱，當季總出貨量年減 1.6%。 與此同時，從美光科技 ( MU-US ) 到小米，愈來愈多科技公司示警，用於裝置資料儲存的半導體供應缺口，正為產業前景增添不確定性。 由於記憶體晶片製造商將更多產能轉向供應輝達 ( NVDA-US ) AI 晶片所需的高階記憶體，導致價格持續走高，也讓難以簽署長期供貨合約的中小型業者承受更大壓力。 Counterpoint 分析師預期，記憶體價格仍將進一步上漲，2026 年第一季漲幅恐達 40% 至 50%，第二季再增加約 20%。 該公司認為，在...

title: 美股周一因馬丁路德金恩紀念日休市
text: 美國周一 (19 日) 為馬丁路德金恩 (Martin Luther King) 紀念日，美國股市與債券市場休市一天，周二恢復正常交易。 CME 旗下貴金屬及美國原油期貨合約交易將於台北時間 20 日 03:30 提前結束，美國國債及股指期貨合約交易則於北京時間 20 日 02:00 提前結束，ICE 及 CBOT 旗下的農產品相關交易將休市一日。 歷史數據顯示，受聯邦節假日影響，市場的交易活動通常會顯著減少。 馬丁路德金日定於每年一月的第三個星期一，旨在表彰這位諾貝爾和平獎得主透過非暴力手段爭取種族平等的貢獻。此節日於 1983 年由時任總統雷根簽署法案成為聯邦法定假日。 上周美股主要指數表現平平， 標普 500 指數 受銀行股財報優異與台積電強勁推升，上漲近 0.2%， 道瓊 因金融股領漲、抵銷利率上限擔憂，上漲近 0.1%， 那斯達克 指數微跌。

title: 想賺AI又怕泡沫？美銀提「完美對沖」策略：改抱這四大相鄰領域
text: 市場對於「AI 泡沫化」的疑慮越來越大，面對高估值帶來的潛動盪，美國銀行策略師提出了一套被稱為「完美對沖」的投資方案，建議採取「投資 AI，但不直接投資 AI 本身」的迂迴策略，藉此捕捉成長機會並抵禦市場波動。 美國銀行分析師指出，雖然目前的牛市不代表泡沫已經形成，且預計到本世紀末，全球 AI 相關投資支出將增長兩倍至 1.2 兆美元，但科技產業的估值過高確實是不爭的事實。 目前納斯達克 100 指數的本益比已攀升至約 37 倍，遠高於 標普 500 指數 的 22 倍。在這種背景下，策略師建議投資人應將目光轉向那些與科技業高度相關、且能受惠於 AI 熱潮的「相鄰領域」，篩選出具有成長潛力且具備「低 AI 貝塔係數」的高品質公司。 在眾多相鄰領域中， 隨著 AI 技術演進，資料中心的能源需求預計將大幅成長。美國銀行認為，電網營運商、輸電設備供應商及再生能源開發商正處於結構性成長的浪頭上。 除了 AI 驅動的需求外，電動車普及、建築電氣化以及各國對能源獨立的重視，都將促使能源存儲與電網擴建的訂單量持續增加，這使得能源基礎設施成為一個相對穩健的投資選擇。 與電氣化息息相關的 。為了重新建構...

title: 高盛2026年中國經濟展望：出口韌性支撐4.8%增長 房地產拖累預計逐年減弱
text: 根據高盛研究部報告指出，儘管中國經濟面臨結構性挑戰，但受惠於強勁的出口表現以及房地產市場對經濟的拖累逐漸減少，預計 2026 年中國實際國內生產毛額 (GDP) 將增長 4.8%。 這一預測值不僅高於市場普遍預期的 4.5%，也反映出高盛對中國政策放寬及出口前景持有更為樂觀的態度。 高盛預測中最具代表性的觀點在於經常帳戶盈餘。高盛預計 2026 年中國經常帳戶盈餘將從 2025 年的 3.6% 上升至 4.2%，而市場普遍預期則會降至 2.5%。這種樂觀情緒源於中國出口展現的強大韌性。 儘管面臨美國關稅壓力，中國出口商已成功轉向新興市場，且在關鍵礦產領域的導地位使得其他國家難以設置重大貿易壁壘。此外，隨著高科技出口潛力的釋放，預計 2026 年以美元計價的出口價格通膨率將轉為正值。 報告指出，中國房地產行業已進入連續第五年的下滑期，新屋開工與投資等指標較巔峰時期下降了 50% 至 80%。高盛首席中國經濟學家閃輝表示，目前房地產市場尚無觸底跡象，預計全國房價可能要到 2027 年才會真正見底。然而，房地產對 GDP 增長的負面影響正在縮小，預計每年的拖累程度將減少約 0.5 個百分點。...

title: 投資人拋售美元、資金轉向避險！市場解讀川普揚言對格陵蘭祭關稅
text: 在美國總統川普揚言，若歐洲盟友阻礙其收購丹麥自治領土格陵蘭的計畫，將對多國祭出懲罰性關稅後，投資人迅速轉向避險資產。歐洲方面也準備展開反制行動，使市場緊張情緒明顯升溫。 根據《路透》報導，川普表示，除非能就格陵蘭達成某種協議，否則美國將自 2 月 1 日起，對來自丹麥、挪威、瑞典、法國、德國、荷蘭、芬蘭與英國的進口商品加徵 10% 關稅，並於 6 月 1 日進一步提高至 25%。 消息傳出後，週一（19 日）亞洲交易時段金融市場出現明顯避險反應。貴金屬與公債價格上揚，股市下挫，美元走弱； 歐元 、 日元 與 瑞士法郎 則全面走高。 分析師和投資者對川普威脅加徵關稅的評論 澳盛銀行（ANZ）亞洲研究主管 Khoon Goh Goh 指出，理論上關稅威脅應該削弱 歐元 ，但實際上，每當美國方面出現高度政策不確定性時，外匯市場的反應反而更偏向美元轉弱。 他認為，市場正在為美元計入更高的政治風險溢價。 Goh 表示，關鍵問題在於歐洲將如何、以及多大程度反擊川普。從目前情勢來看，美歐貿易協議恐怕難以落實，美英之間的貿易協議前景也變得更加不確定。 瑞穗銀行（Mizuho）亞洲（不含日本）宏觀研究主...

title: Australia Day long weekend beer supply under threat by TWU strike action | Daily Telegraph
text: Beer supplies are at risk of running dry across the Australia Day long weekend, with transport workers planning strike action over a pay dispute. Transport Workers Union WA (TWU) said drivers working for Qube Logistics in Western Australia and Victoria will stop work for 24 hours from 5am on Wednesday, putting the supply of Asahi beer, Coca-Cola and Mondelez chocolates over the long weekend at risk. The union plans to disrupt supply chains if the logistic company continues to refuse drivers’ wage demands, conditions and a consolidated agreement to align West Australian drivers with their Victorian counterparts. Transport Workers Union drivers in Western Australia and Victoria plan to stop work for 24 hours over a pay dispute with Qube Logistics. Picture: NewsWire/Philip Gostelow The TWU have been pushing for a national agreement with decent wages and safe working conditions after some drivers have not received a “fair wage increase” in four years. TWU WA State Secretary Tim Dawson said consolidating the Qube agreement nationally was a critical part of the union’s 2026 plan to lift standards across the industry. “Transport is already Australia’s deadliest industry. Fragmented agreements and cost-cutting only make it worse,” he said. “The TWU has a plan for 2026. Consolidating agreements like Qube’s across states is how we stop the race to the bottom and protect safe, sustainable jobs.” TWU VIC/TAS Director of Organising Sam lynch said workers wages are falling behind. “Qube, who have recorded year-on-year profit increases, need to come back to the negotiation table and get serious.” TWU officials say fragmented agreements and cost-cutting only made Australia’s transport industry worse Picture: NewsWire / Flavio Brancaleone A Qube spokesman said it was “disappointing” the union were trying to mount a “phony scare campaign” instead of engaging in good faith negotiations. The company has alternative supply arrangements in place if the strike action proceeds to mitigate any impacts to customers, supply chains or consumers. The action is likely to involve five drivers in Western Australia and up to 12 drivers in Victoria. Qube logistics has put alternative arrangements in place to mitigate any strike action. Picture: Supplied “The truth is the TWU have rejected a wage offer that would have seen workers covered by agreements in Victoria and WA achieve a wage increase of more than 12 per cent over the next three years and then they walked away from the negotiating table,” a spokesman said. “We urge the union to urgently resume negotiations so that we can resolve this dispute in the best interests of workers.” Originally published as Beer supplies across Australia Day long weekend under threat as transport union warns of strike action

title: Inflation, interest rates: IMF warns Australia faces years of economic pain ahead | Daily Telegraph
text: Australia is forecast to face a prolonged period of above-average inflation and below-trend economic growth, as global tariffs weigh on the national economy. In its latest economic outlook, the International Monetary Fund (IMF) warns Australia will not be immune to cost of living pain, as US President Donald Trump’s tariff policy flows through. “With pass-through from higher tariffs gradually materialising, US core inflation is projected to return to the country’s 2 per cent target during 2027,” the IMF report states. “Australia and Norway are also projected to see some drawn-out persistence in above-target inflation.” Australia faces a prolonged period of above average inflation. Picture: NewsWire / Nicholas Eagar Australia’s headline annual inflation rate dropped to 3.4 per cent from 3.8 per cent for the 12 months until November, according to official figures released in early January. Meanwhile, the all important trimmed mean inflation rate – which the Reserve Bank uses as it strips out volatile items including fuel – slipped to 3.2 per cent from 3.3 per cent for the year. And while inflation remains above the Reserve Bank target of 2 to 3 per cent, Australia’s economy will also continue to grow at below trend pace. According to Australia’s treasury department, inflation will return to the target range next financial year. Experts are divided about Australia’s current inflation rate and what it could mean for interest rates. Commonwealth Bank and National Australia Bank are both calling a rate rise after the RBA’s meeting on February 2-3, while Westpac and ANZ forecasts rates will be left on hold. According to the IMF, global inflation will continue to decline falling from 3.8 per cent in 2026 to 3.4 per cent in 2027. Treasurer Jim Chalmers said the economic note highlights the current challenges for global economies. “The global economy is incredibly uncertain with persistently high inflation still a challenge for many countries around the world, and that’s reflected in this report,” he said “Volatility in the global economy was a key feature of my discussions with international counterparts last week and it will continue to weigh heavily on Australia in the months and years ahead.” Treasurer Jim Chalmers points Australia is not the only country facing inflation issues. Picture: NewsWire / Pool/ Martin Ollman The IMF also maintains its estimates Australia’s economic growth will pick up marginally from 1.9 per cent in 2025, to 2.1 per cent in 2026 and 2.2 per cent in 2027. Despite the below trend growth, Australia will actually grow faster than the combined advanced economies is projected to be 1.8 per cent in 2026 and 1.7 per cent in 2027. Advanced economies include the United States, Canada, most of Europe, Japan, Singapore, South Korea, Taiwan, Australia and New Zealand. The US effective tariff rate underlying the projections is 18.5 per cent, compared with 18.7 per cent in the October forecast. The corresponding effective tariff rate for the rest of the world is unchanged at 3.5 per cent. Originally published as IMF warns of drawn-out cost of...

title: Chris Webster practice closure follows Patterson controversy | Daily Telegraph
text: The doctor who first alerted police about mushroom murderer Erin Patterson is closing down his local practice to avoid “financial oblivion”. Dr Chris Webster treated two of Patterson’s guests, Ian and Heather Wilkinson, after the fateful meal, and he had arranged a transfer to a bigger hospital when the mother-of-two walked in. Patterson presented herself to emergency and said she had gastro. The doctor was quick to put puzzle pieces together, knowing three patients were being treated for suspected poisoning. He questioned Patterson and told her they needed to commence treatment on her for potential poisoning, prompting Patterson to leave the hospital. Patterson was later convicted of three counts of murder and one count of attempted murder, and sentenced to a minimum 33-year non-parole period. She maintains her innocence and is appealing. Patterson and the mushroom trial caught the entire nations attention. Picture: Brooke, Grebert-Craig. During an interview with The Herald Sun last year, Dr Webster called Patterson a “disturbed sociopathic nut bag” and even a “crazy b***h,” among other statements. The series of comments resulted in punishment from Australia’s medical regulator. Dr Webster was forced to complete ethics training and was no longer allowed to supervise training GPs. In an interview with the Herald Sun, Dr Webster revealed why he chose to close down the rural clinic. He said it was both the lack of support from the Royal Australian College of General Practitioners and a refusal from colleagues to limit bulk billing that was putting his practice on the road to “financial oblivion”. Dr Webster became a key witness in the trial last year and says he remains committed to serving his community. Picture: NewsWire / Nicki Connolly The doctor said he would like to look at opening a “boutique” practice, for patients that approved his “compassion and skill,” he told the masthead “It will be a radically downsized clinic,” Dr Webster said. “I’ve got the community’s back and they’ve got mine. My books are always open,” he said. Leongatha Healthcare appear to have limited phone calls but are accepting appointments via HotDoc until early March. A spokesperson from the clinic also made contact with the Herald Sun. “There are a number of complex issues underlying the current situation, including longstanding concerns raised by staff and clinicians regarding workplace safety and governance,” the spokesperson said. Dr Webster and Leongatha Healthcare have been contacted for comment. Originally published as Doctor who exposed mushroom murderer Erin Patterson closes rural clinic, cites risk of ‘financial oblivion’

title: Under-19 World Cup: Australia will look to Will Malajczuk to set the tone with another aggressive start
text: Don't miss out on the headlines from Cricket. Followed categories will be added to My News. Australia has given Will Malajczuk a licence to thrill at the top of the order this Under-19 World Cup. The Aussies claimed a comfortable victory against Ireland on Friday, reaching the 236 target with eight wickets and 10 overs in hand. Malajczuk (22) was the only player in the top three to register a low score, with Steve Hogan (115) and Nitesh Samuel (77no) carrying the Aussies’ chase. But coach Tim Nielsen is backing the West Australian to make another aggressive start when the Aussies meet Japan on Tuesday night. “It’s certainly a bit of a planned attack on how we might attack our batting innings,” Nielsen said. Will Malajczuk may benefit from the ball travelling further in Namibia’s higher altitude when he attacks the new ball. Picture: Albert Perez/Getty Images “He played unbelievably well in the practice game against South Africa, got 80 odd off about 50 basically. “We feel as though we’re going to be playing against a fair bit of spin, so if we can get off to a bit of a start and add a bit of pressure on the opposition, we feel as though we might be able to change when they use their spinners. “If he does come off, it just gives the rest of the batting order that pillow, or buffer, that we’re going quickly at the start and they don’t have to be too panicky. “250 seems the going rate when teams play well, maybe a little bit more, so if we can get off to a bit of a start we feel we can take a chunk out of that total, especially if we’re chasing. “If he doesn’t come off, we’ve got the batting depth we feel to knuckle down and chase it through.” Tim Nielsen coached Australia in an ODI World Cup in 2011. Nielsen says a lot of Japanese players is familiar with the Aussies, having played club or school cricket Down Under before the tournament. He says the importance of a second win will be top of mind for his team, knowing how much it could set up their assault towards finals. “I think we need to make sure we’re on our game and not take (Japan) lightly … if we are to win tomorrow, it probably sees us qualify for the super six stage and then our game on Friday against Sri Lanka will almost be to see if we finish first or second,” he said. title: Man taken to hospital after fox attack in Romsey, Victoria | Daily Telegraph
text: Don't miss out on the headlines from Animals. Followed categories will be added to My News. A man has been hospitalised following a fox attack in regional Victoria. The incident happened on the man’s Macedon Ranges property at Romsey, about 67km north of Melbourne, at 6am on Monday. Victoria Ambulance advanced life support paramedics responded to the incident and provided care to a man in his 50s, who suffered lower body injuries from a fox bite. A man has been attacked by a fox at his Macedon Ranges property at Romsey, about 67km north of Melbourne. A spokesman said the victim was rushed to Northern Hospital in a stable condition. Exotic wildlife vet Nicole Su told 9 News it was the first time she had heard of such a bad attack on a person. “Unfortunately we are seeing (foxes) encroaching onto more and more urban areas and we’re having more sightings as well, and what we are seeing is they are getting bolder,” she said. title: What’s open Australia Day 2026: shops, supermarkets and services | Daily Telegraph
text: Australians are set to enjoy a three-day break as Australia Day falls next Monday, giving many the perfect excuse to relax, catch up with friends, or head out and enjoy what’s on offer. Whether you’re planning a barbecue, tackling a home project, or squeezing in some shopping before the festivities, most major retailers and services will be open nationwide, although trading hours will vary depending on where you live. Major shopping centres follow state-specific trading rules: Canberra Centre and Canberra Outlet in the ACT will be open, while Rundle Mall in Adelaide will trade from 11am to 5pm. Picture: NewsWire / John Gass Supermarkets and major retailers Coles and Woolworths supermarkets will largely remain open across the country, with public holiday hours applying in most states. Stores in NSW, Victoria, the ACT and Tasmania are expected to trade close to normal hours, while Queensland outlets will generally open later and close earlier unless located in tourist precincts. South Australia will again have the strictest rules, with most metropolitan supermarkets closed and limited CBD and regional trading available. Western Australia and the Northern Territory will operate under government-approved public holiday hours. Big W and Kmart will also trade across most of the country, though several South Australian and regional stores will close for the day. DIY enthusiasts can breathe easy, with Bunnings Warehouse stores open nationwide throughout the long weekend. Trade Centres, however, will remain closed on the public holiday. Liquor stores Bottle shops will be open in most areas, making it easy to stock up for celebrations. Dan Murphy’s stores are expected to open from about 10am and close between 6pm and 7pm, while BWS and Liquorland outlets will trade with reduced hours depending on state and council regulations. Some regional and remote stores may remain closed. Bunnings Warehouse stores are open nationwide, so DIY enthusiasts can still tackle home projects, though Trade Centres will remain closed for the public holiday. Picture: NewsWire / Andrew Henshaw Shopping centres Shopping centre trading will depend heavily on state legislation. Centres in the ACT, parts of Queensland and the Northern Territory will be open with reduced hours, while South Australia’s Rundle Mall will be one of the few metropolitan shopping districts open in that state. Transport and services Public transport services will run on public holiday or weekend timetables in major cities, with additional services in some areas to support Australia Day events and fireworks. Commuters are advised to plan ahead, particularly in Sydney and Perth, where road closures and ferry disruptions will occur around evening celebrations. Australia Post outlets will be closed, with no mail deliveries taking place. Many cafes and restaurants will open but may apply a public holiday surcharge of about 10–15 per cent. title: Hanson claims Charlie Kirk ‘assassination’ boosted One Nation poll | Daily Telegraph
text: Pauline Hanson has claimed the alleged assassination of right-wing political pundit Charlie Kirk was a “wake up call” to Australians, while positioning herself as the promulgator of the global right. Support for Pauline Hanson’s One Nation party overtook the Coalition in the latest Newspoll survey for the first time, after surging seven points over the past two months to a whopping 22 per cent of the primary vote. Addressing the surge, Senator Hanson told reporters on Monday she had “been around long before Nigel Farage and long before (Donald) Trump”. “So, therefore, I’ve set the record, my record, what I want,” she said. “Don’t look at my speeches, what I’ve said in the past. I don’t back away from anything. I stand up for what I believe in. One Nation leader Senator Pauline Hanson claimed the alleged assassination of Charlie Kirk was a ‘wake up call’ to Australians while addressing her party’s astonishing rise in the latest Newspoll. Picture: NewsWire / Martin Ollman “And, that’s why now the people are seeing I have been someone who stood my ground over the years, that a lot of things that I’ve said and done over the years has now happened in our country.” Senator Hanson said she was “proud to acknowledged” One Nation’s polling and said both major parties were “lacking”. Australians were “fed up” and struggling with cost of living, she said. “But, I think it’s also seeing what happened with Bondi, and I think prior to that with Charlie Kirk, his assassination, has been a big wake up call for a lot of Australians. “Mass migration has also been huge, big issue for a lot of Australians who have been now for years calling out to this government (to) pull back on it. “Lack of housing, jobs, security, cost of living is a combination of a lot of things, and what they’re looking for is someone who really cares about their country, about them and about the future of the nation.” Senator Hanson has sought to blame “radical Islam” and immigration for the Bondi Beach terror attack. title: 11yo surfer ‘rattled’ amid second shark attack
text: An 11-year-old surfer is “rattled” after a shark took multiple bites out of his surfboard in Sydney’s northern beaches – less than 24 hours after a horrifying shark attack in the city’s east. The boy was surfing at Dee Why on Monday morning when what is believed to be a four or five-metre bull shark lunged up at his board. The shark managed to bite at the boy’s board multiple times; however, he was unharmed. The Manly Observer reports that an older surfer helped the boy after he screamed for help. A photo of the boy’s surfboard shows a giant chunk taken out of the side. The incident comes just a day after a 12-year-old boy was left with critical injuries to both of his legs after a brutal shark attack in Sydney’s east. The 11-year-old boy’s board had a chunk taken out from the side. Picture: The Manly Observer Emergency services were called to Hermitage Foreshore Walk on Steele Point Road at Vaucluse about 4.20pm on Sunday following reports of a shark attack. His friends bravely worked together to pull him from the water, police said, exposing themselves to his “confronting” injuries in the process. He was transported by boat to Rose Bay, where he was taken to the Children’s Hospital in Randwick. Senior Constable John Morris told Sunrise the boy had “double tourniquets” applied to his legs by paramedics and police on the rock shelf. The scene at Rose Bay Wharf after a teenager was evacuated from Neilsen Park, Vaucluse, to an ambulance after a shark attack near Nielsen Park Beach. Picture: NewsWire / Justin Lloyd “The double tourniquet system, we think, stemmed the loss of blood at that scene,” he said. He has since undergone surgery and remains in a critical condition with his parents by his side. Speaking to reporters on Monday, he said the boy lost a significant amount of blood and was unconscious when paramedics arrived. “The boy had lost his pulse, there was a large blood loss, and the double tourniquet stemmed that flow of blood loss yesterday, and has contributed to saving his life,” he said. Friends praised for ‘brave’ act Constable Morris told reporters the boy was jumping off a six-metre rock with a group of teenage friends when the attack happened. Paramedics took the boy to hospital in a critical condition. Picture: ABC “We believe the combination of the brackish water, the freshwater, and the actions of the splashing may have made that perfect storm environment for that shark attack yesterday,” he said. He told Sunrise the water had become “muddy” after the bouts of rain over the weekend. “(The boys) were jumping into muddy water, and what we believe is a shark was in the vicinity, has bitten that boy’s legs,” he said. “One of his mates did jump in to pull him from the water’s edge to that rock platform as well, so he contributed to saving his life as well yesterday.” Originally published as 11yo surfer ‘rattled’...

title: Labor strategist Tim Picton dies weeks after alleged attack | Daily Telegraph
text: Don't miss out on the headlines from WA News. Followed categories will be added to My News. Tim Picton, a prominent former Labor strategist, has died after spending weeks in a critical condition, following an alleged assault outside a Perth nightclub. Mr Picton, 36, played a key role in WA Labor’s 2021 state election campaign, helping secure a landslide victory, and most recently served as director of strategy at mining company Mineral Resources. He is the brother of South Australian Health Minister Chris Picton. Tim Picton has died following an assault in Perth CBD. Picture: Supplied by family, Brodie Jake Dewar, 20, has been charged with grievous bodily harm in connection with the December incident, during which Mr Picton was allegedly knocked unconscious. Mr Picton’s family confirmed his death on Monday, describing him as a “deeply devoted father and loving husband, son, grandson, brother and uncle”. “We are devastated by the loss of our beloved Tim, who passed away earlier today surrounded by his family,” the statement said. “His kindness, generosity and humour brought joy to our lives. Tim – we love you, we miss you and we will always carry your memory with us.” Brodie Jake Dewar, 20, has been charged over the alleged assault on Tim Picton. Mr Picton was the father of four-year-old Charlotte, whom his family described as “the love of his life”. “It breaks our hearts to know that Charlotte will grow up without her father by her side, but she will always know how deeply he loved her,” the statement said. title: Saurom anuncia Meet & Greet exclusivo previo a su concierto en El Salvador
text: Los seguidores salvadoreños de Saurom tendrán una oportunidad única de convivir de cerca con la banda española de juglar metal, gracias al Meet & Greet oficial que se realizará el domingo 17 de mayo de 2026, como antesala a su esperado concierto en el país. title: La cuarta temporada de “Bridgerton” apuesta por un amor prohibido y temas actuales
text: La alta sociedad londinense vuelve a acaparar miradas. La cuarta temporada de “Bridgerton” fue presentada por todo lo alto en París, adelantando lo que Netflix estrenará el próximo 29 de enero: una historia inspirada en Cenicienta, pero con un giro inesperado y mucho más profundo. Cientos de fanáticos se reunieron la noche del miércoles en el Palacio Brongniart, en pleno corazón de la capital francesa, que se transformó en un escenario digno de la serie. El lugar fue decorado con los colores de “Bridgerton” y una pasarela ambientada como jardín inglés, por donde desfilaron las estrellas del elenco entre aplausos y cámaras. Estrenada en 2020, la producción —basada en las novelas de la escritora estadounidense Julia Quinn— se sitúa en la Inglaterra de principios del siglo XIX, donde los escándalos, romances y secretos de la élite londinense se mezclan con una narrativa moderna e inclusiva. La historia sigue a los ocho hermanos de la influyente familia Bridgerton, y cada temporada se enfoca en uno de ellos. googletag.cmd.push(); Te puede interesar: 'Euphoria' temporada 3 se estrena el 12 de abril con salto temporal En esta ocasión, el protagonismo recae en Benedict Bridgerton (interpretado por Luke Thompson), el segundo hijo de la familia, un artista bohemio y libertino que queda cautivado por la enigmática Sophie Baek. Lo que él ignora es que ella, al igual que en el clásico cuento de hadas, es en realidad una sirvienta. El elenco de “Bridgerton” desfiló en París durante la presentación oficial de la cuarta temporada de la exitosa serie de Netflix. Fotografía/ X @bridgerton “Diría que es un poco Cenicienta con un giro, y no exactamente Cenicienta. Es una historia de lucha de clases y de amor prohibido”, explicó a AFP la actriz Yerin Ha, de origen australocoreano, quien da vida a Sophie. Te recomendamos: Bruno Mars amplía su gira mundial por la alta demanda y suma 69 conciertos googletag.cmd.push(); Más allá del romance, la nueva temporada no le huye a temas actuales. Las intrigas abordarán asuntos como las relaciones entre nobles y sirvientes, la discapacidad, la violencia de género e incluso la sexualidad femenina después de la menopausia, consolidando el sello social que ha distinguido a la serie. Un rostro conocido para los fans será el de Katie Leung, recordada por su papel de Cho Chang en la saga de Harry Potter, quien interpreta a la cruel ama —y madrastra— de Sophie. Netflix confirmó que “Bridgerton” se mantiene como uno de sus contenidos más exitosos desde su estreno, logrando posicionarse durante semanas en el top 10 global. Además, las temporadas cinco y seis ya están aseguradas, para tranquilidad de sus millones de seguidores alrededor del mundo. googletag.cmd.push(); CATEGORIA:  Entretenimiento | Escena

title: Video| Agua Escondida, el rincón con vista al fin del mundo en La Unión
text: Ubicado a solo 20 minutos del centro urbano de La Unión, el cantón Agua Escondida se posiciona como un destino emergente para quienes buscan rutas panorámicas poco exploradas. Su principal atractivo es la calle conocida como el Mirador del Fin del Mundo, un tramo desde el cual se observan espectaculares vistas del Golfo de Fonseca, incluyendo las islas salvadoreñas Zacatillo y Martín Pérez, y la hondureña Amapala. Esta experiencia visual ha ganado fuerza gracias a visitantes que comparten sus recorridos en redes sociales, lo que ha impulsado el turismo de forma orgánica. Cómo llegar desde San Salvador y qué ver en la zona Para llegar a Agua Escondida desde San Salvador, podés tomar la ruta 304 desde la Terminal de Oriente. El trayecto toma entre tres horas y media y casi cinco, dependiendo del servicio. Una vez en la ciudad de La Unión, el acceso al cantón es directo por carretera, y es posible llegar en mototaxi o vehículo particular. Además del mirador, la zona permite apreciar la playa El Chiquirín y su muelle, otro punto atractivo para quienes desean estar cerca del mar. El parque central del cantón, construido en 1972 por iniciativa comunitaria, también destaca por su limpieza y diseño. googletag.cmd.push(); Un destino con identidad comunitaria y potencial turístico Agua Escondida está conformado por seis sectores: Brisas del Golfo, Playitas, Pueblo Viejo, Los Chorros, Los Manguitos y Chiquirín. En conjunto, suman una población aproximada de mil personas que han desarrollado el lugar con base en esfuerzo propio. Este enfoque ha permitido preservar la tranquilidad del entorno, que resulta ideal para descansar o explorar el patrimonio natural. Además del valor escénico, la historia del lugar, originado en terrenos repartidos durante el siglo XX, agrega una dimensión cultural a la visita. CATEGORIA:  Turismo | Rutas y aventuras

title: Embutidos Amparito: 100 años de tradición y sabor en Cojutepeque
text: En Cojutepeque, uno de los municipios con mayor tradición cultural y gastronómica de El Salvador, existe un negocio que ha logrado trascender generaciones, cambios y el paso del tiempo. Se trata de Embutidos Amparito, un establecimiento familiar que recientemente superó los 100 años de existencia, dedicados a la elaboración artesanal de chorizos, uno de los sabores más emblemáticos de la ciudad. “Este lugar es muy reconocido tanto por salvadoreños como por extranjeros”, cuenta doña Amparo, conocida cariñosamente como Amparito, actual encargada del negocio y representante de la tercera generación de una familia que ha hecho del trabajo, la constancia y la calidad su sello distintivo. El centenario fue cumplido el 8 de mayo de 2025, una fecha que marcó no solo un aniversario, sino la continuidad de una historia profundamente ligada a Cojutepeque. googletag.cmd.push(); Leer más: Parrilladas que debés probar en San Salvador Embutidos Amaparito con una historia de 100 años en Cojutepeque. Foto Emerson Del Cid La tradición comenzó con su abuela, Isabel Arias, quien inició la elaboración y venta de chorizos en condiciones muy distintas a las actuales. Posteriormente, el legado pasó a manos de su madre, Amparo Herrera, quien modernizó poco a poco el negocio sin perder su esencia. Hoy, doña Amparo continúa el trabajo junto a sus hijos, asegurando que la tradición no se pierda. “Yo ya soy la tercera generación, pero ahora también están mis hijos. Eso me llena de orgullo, porque hemos tratado de mantener este negocio y Dios nos ha dado la fortaleza para llegar hasta estos tiempos”, expresa. Para ella, el verdadero reconocimiento viene de los clientes, quienes regresan una y otra vez atraídos por el sabor y la confianza en el producto. googletag.cmd.push(); En Embutidos Amparito se puede encontrar entre Longanizas, chorizos, butifarras, salchichones, chorizo asado, carne asada, panes con chorizo y más. Foto Emerson Del Cid Durante las fiestas patronales de Cojutepeque y todo el año, Embutidos Amparito se convierte en un punto de encuentro obligado. “Los choricitos son un patrimonio de Cojutepeque. Invitamos a todos a que vengan a conocer y a disfrutarlos. Las fiestas son alegres, seguras y muy bonitas”, comenta, extendiendo una invitación tanto a salvadoreños como a visitantes extranjeros. El secreto de su permanencia no está en fórmulas industriales ni en producción masiva. Amparito explica que la base del éxito ha sido siempre la calidad. “Procuramos que la carne sea excelente, cuidamos mucho el aseo y los ingredientes. Todo lo preparo yo y tratamos de que sea lo más natural posible”, señala. googletag.cmd.push(); Los chorizos de Amparito son completamente artesanales y cada paso del proceso requiere atención y cuidado. Desde la selección de las especias hasta el uso de la tripa y la manipulación del producto, todo se hace de forma tradicional. “Todo lleva su proceso y hay que tener mucho cuidado al elaborarlo. Eso es lo que nos ha mantenido vivos como negocio”, explica. Doña Amparito guarda recuerdos de la historia del lugar y de las personas extranjeras y locales que llegan a degustar los...

title: Conocé los precios de la gasolina y diésel en El Salvador esta quincena
text: Los precios de los combustibles en El Salvador se mantienen sin variación para el período del 20 de enero al 2 de febrero de 2026, según lo informó la Dirección General de Energía, Hidrocarburos y Minas. Esta decisión aplica para las zonas central, occidental y oriental del país, manteniéndose las tarifas actuales para gasolina especial, regular y diésel. En la zona central, el precio de referencia del galón de gasolina especial es de $3.83, el de gasolina regular es de $3.55, y el del diésel es de $3.42. Para la zona occidental, los precios son de $3.84, $3.56 y $3.43 respectivamente, mientras que en la zona oriental se registran los valores más altos: $3.87 para la especial, $3.59 para la regular y $3.47 para el diésel. Precio de los combustibles subirán hasta $0.05 ctvs para la siguiente quincena / Foto Freepik Zonas, precios y vigencia Los precios de referencia, establecidos por el Gobierno de El Salvador, continuarán vigentes hasta el 2 de febrero de 2026. Esta estabilidad busca ofrecer a los consumidores y al sector transporte una referencia clara de costos en los distintos puntos del país. Los precios se distribuyen así: Zona Central Gasolina especial: $3.83 Gasolina regular: $3.55 Diésel: $3.42 Zona Occidental Gasolina especial: $3.84 Gasolina regular: $3.56 Diésel: $3.43 Zona Oriental Gasolina especial: $3.87 Gasolina regular: $3.59 Diésel: $3.47 ¿Cómo aprovechar esta estabilidad? Informamos a todos los salvadoreños los nuevos precios de referencia del #CombustibleSV , con vigencia del 20 de enero al 2 de febrero de 2026. 🇸🇻 pic.twitter.com/e62EryCCjV — Dirección de Energía, Hidrocarburos y Minas (@DGEHMSV) January 19, 2026 La Dirección de Energía, Hidrocarburos y Minas recomienda usar este periodo de precios constantes para organizar mejor los gastos y desplazamientos. Algunas sugerencias prácticas incluyen: Planificar viajes largos en estas semanas para aprovechar los precios actuales. Revisar el vehículo: un mantenimiento preventivo mejora el rendimiento del combustible. Evitar traslados innecesarios y reorganizar entregas o visitas para mayor eficiencia. Mantener tarifas sin cambios, especialmente en negocios que compiten por precio. Te puede interesar: Reforma de pensiones en El Salvador: ¿cómo impactará en tu ahorro y en la estabilidad fiscal? Atención al mercado internacional Si bien esta es una buena noticia para el inicio del año, las autoridades recordaron que los precios del combustible están sujetos al comportamiento del mercado internacional del crudo. Factores externos como conflictos geopolíticos, producción petrolera o demanda global pueden provocar futuras variaciones. Por ello, se recomienda mantenerse informado a través de los canales oficiales de la Dirección, que publica actualizaciones de precios cada quince días. Esto permite anticipar ajustes y tomar decisiones informadas.

title: Oro y plata alcanzan máximos históricos por tensión entre Estados Unidos y Europa
text: El oro y la plata registraron un alza histórica en los mercados internacionales este lunes, impulsadas por el incremento de tensiones diplomáticas entre Estados Unidos y varios países de Europa. Durante la sesión matinal en las bolsas asiáticas, el oro alcanzó los 4,690.59 dólares por onza y la plata llegó a los 94.12 dólares por onza, cifras récord atribuidas a un aumento en la demanda de activos refugio. Las palabras clave que dominan esta jornada son: mercados, aranceles y Groenlandia. El aumento en el valor de estos metales preciosos se produjo tras la declaración del presidente estadounidense, Donald Trump, quien reiteró su intención de que EE.UU. tome el control de Groenlandia, una región autónoma bajo la soberanía de Dinamarca. Trump anunció un paquete de aranceles del 10% sobre las importaciones de Dinamarca, Noruega, Suecia, Francia, Alemania, Reino Unido, Países Bajos y Finlandia, con entrada en vigor a partir del 1 de febrero. Según lo expresado, las tarifas aumentarían al 25% desde el 1 de junio si no se accede a las demandas estadounidenses. Impacto inmediato en los mercados globales Vista de un barco danés en agua de Nuuk, Groenlandia. / Foto EFE El anuncio provocó una reacción inmediata en los mercados financieros. Mientras el dólar se debilitaba, los futuros europeos y estadounidenses mostraban caídas. En Asia, las bolsas de Tokio, Hong Kong, Shanghái, Sídney, Singapur y Wellington abrieron a la baja. Por otro lado, Seúl y Taipéi mostraron ganancias moderadas en la misma jornada. Te puede interesar: Mercado de valores salvadoreño crece 7.2% y consolida confianza de inversionistas Los inversionistas optaron por refugiarse en activos considerados seguros, como el oro y la plata, una tendencia común en contextos de incertidumbre geopolítica. Esta preferencia se reflejó en la fuerte alza de ambos metales preciosos, utilizados históricamente como reserva de valor en tiempos de volatilidad. Postura estadounidense sobre Groenlandia intensifica la tensión La controversia se intensificó luego de que el presidente Trump declarara que “se hará” el control estadounidense sobre Groenlandia, aludiendo a razones de seguridad nacional ante la creciente influencia de Rusia y China en el Ártico. A través de su cuenta en Truth Social, el mandatario aseguró que la OTAN ha advertido durante dos décadas a Dinamarca sobre la “amenaza rusa” en la isla, y criticó la falta de acción de ese país. Trump indicó que todos los países europeos mencionados han enviado tropas a Groenlandia y que los aranceles buscan presionar para obtener respaldo a los planes de anexión. La medida fue anunciada luego de que fracasaran negociaciones entre Estados Unidos, Dinamarca y las autoridades de Groenlandia el viernes anterior.

title: Nuevas leyes que entraron en vigencia a partir de enero en Estados Unidos - Noticias de El Salvador
text: Desde el 1 de enero de 2026, distintos estados de Estados Unidos comenzaron a aplicar un paquete de nuevas leyes que introducen cambios relevantes en áreas como medioambiente, tecnología, seguridad laboral, protección de menores y control de actividades comerciales. Las disposiciones afectan tanto a residentes como a empresas, turistas y profesionales que operan o viajan dentro del país, según información recopilada por Infobae a partir de fuentes oficiales estatales. Las normas, vigentes en estados como California, Indiana, Virginia, Maryland, Tennessee, Texas y Washington, responden a diagnósticos institucionales vinculados a la reducción de residuos, la seguridad en entornos laborales, el uso responsable de tecnologías emergentes y la protección de grupos vulnerables. De acuerdo con Infobae, los cambios suponen nuevas obligaciones para comercios, plataformas digitales, organizaciones benéficas y empleadores, además de sanciones para quienes incumplan la legislación. El conjunto de leyes refleja una tendencia creciente hacia una mayor regulación estatal, con el objetivo de elevar estándares ambientales, sociales y de transparencia en distintos sectores de la economía y la vida cotidiana. Te puede interesar: Advertencia para viajar a Guatemala por tensión en seguridad y operativos Prohibición total de bolsas plásticas en California Uno de los cambios más visibles es la prohibición absoluta de bolsas plásticas en California. La ley SB 1053, en vigor desde enero de 2026, elimina cualquier excepción relacionada con el grosor del material y obliga a supermercados, grandes almacenes y farmacias a entregar únicamente bolsas de papel reciclado, cobrando un monto mínimo por cada una. Según información de CalRecycle, la medida busca reducir la acumulación de residuos plásticos en vertederos y minimizar el impacto ambiental sobre la fauna. La agencia estatal señaló que la mayoría de los consumidores no reutilizaba las bolsas plásticas más gruesas, lo que motivó el endurecimiento de la normativa previa de 2014. La ley contempla sanciones para los comercios que no cumplan y campañas informativas para fomentar el uso de materiales reciclables. Nuevas reglas para juegos benéficos en Indiana En Indiana, la Gaming Commission estableció nuevas restricciones para los juegos benéficos como el bingo o eventos tipo casino con fines de caridad. Desde 2026, una misma instalación solo puede albergar este tipo de actividades hasta tres noches por semana, sin importar cuántas organizaciones participen. La decisión se tomó tras investigaciones oficiales que detectaron el uso de estos eventos como casinos encubiertos. La regulación aplica a clubes privados y salones de eventos, y tiene como finalidad preservar la integridad de las actividades benéficas y evitar el desvío de fondos. Límites al uso de redes sociales por menores en Virginia Virginia se convirtió en el primer estado en imponer un límite horario concreto al uso de redes sociales por menores. La nueva ley restringe a una hora diaria el acceso a plataformas digitales para menores de 16 años, salvo autorización expresa de padres o tutores. El texto legal, obliga a las empresas tecnológicas a implementar sistemas efectivos de verificación de edad y control parental. Además, prevé sanciones para las plataformas que no garanticen el cumplimiento del límite,...

title: Embutidos Amparito: 100 años de tradición en Cojutepeque - Noticias de El Salvador
text: En Cojutepeque, uno de los municipios con mayor tradición cultural y gastronómica de El Salvador, existe un negocio que ha logrado trascender generaciones, cambios y el paso del tiempo. Se trata de Embutidos Amparito , un establecimiento familiar que recientemente superó los 100 años de existencia , dedicados a la elaboración artesanal de chorizos, uno de los sabores más emblemáticos de la ciudad. “Este lugar es muy reconocido tanto por salvadoreños como por extranjeros”, cuenta doña Amparo , conocida cariñosamente como Amparito , actual encargada del negocio y representante de la tercera generación de una familia que ha hecho del trabajo, la constancia y la calidad su sello distintivo. El centenario fue cumplido el 8 de mayo de 2025 , una fecha que marcó no solo un aniversario, sino la continuidad de una historia profundamente ligada a Cojutepeque. Leer más: Parrilladas que debés probar en San Salvador Embutidos Amaparito con una historia de 100 años en Cojutepeque. Foto Emerson Del Cid La tradición comenzó con su abuela, Isabel Arias , quien inició la elaboración y venta de chorizos en condiciones muy distintas a las actuales. Posteriormente, el legado pasó a manos de su madre, Amparo Herrera , quien modernizó poco a poco el negocio sin perder su esencia. Hoy, doña Amparo continúa el trabajo junto a sus hijos, asegurando que la tradición no se pierda. “Yo ya soy la tercera generación, pero ahora también están mis hijos. Eso me llena de orgullo, porque hemos tratado de mantener este negocio y Dios nos ha dado la fortaleza para llegar hasta estos tiempos”, expresa. Para ella, el verdadero reconocimiento viene de los clientes, quienes regresan una y otra vez atraídos por el sabor y la confianza en el producto. En Embutidos Amparito se puede encontrar entre Longanizas, chorizos, butifarras, salchichones, chorizo asado, carne asada, panes con chorizo y más. Foto Emerson Del Cid Durante las fiestas patronales de Cojutepeque y todo el año, Embutidos Amparito se convierte en un punto de encuentro obligado. “Los choricitos son un patrimonio de Cojutepeque. Invitamos a todos a que vengan a conocer y a disfrutarlos. Las fiestas son alegres, seguras y muy bonitas”, comenta, extendiendo una invitación tanto a salvadoreños como a visitantes extranjeros. El secreto de su permanencia no está en fórmulas industriales ni en producción masiva. Amparito explica que la base del éxito ha sido siempre la calidad . “Procuramos que la carne sea excelente, cuidamos mucho el aseo y los ingredientes. Todo lo preparo yo y tratamos de que sea lo más natural posible”, señala. Los chorizos de Amparito son completamente artesanales y cada paso del proceso requiere atención y cuidado. Desde la selección de las especias hasta el uso de la tripa y la manipulación del producto, todo se hace de forma tradicional. “Todo lleva su proceso y hay que tener mucho cuidado al elaborarlo. Eso es lo que nos ha mantenido vivos como negocio”, explica. Doña Amparito guarda recuerdos de la historia del lugar y de las personas extranjeras y locales...

title: CollegeDekho names Tapan Jindal as Chief Financial Officer
text: Gurugram: CollegeDekho, the ed-tech startup by CarDekho Group has today announced the appointment of Tapan Jindal as Chief Financial Officer (CFO) as the education services company looks to strengthen its financial governance framework and prepare for next stage of growth. The appointment follows CarDekho’s $10Mn investment in the startup later last year. In his new role, Tapan will join the company’s core leadership team, leading its finance, legal and compliance functions with a focus on corporate governance, capital efficiency, and long-term strategic planning. Tapan, a Chartered Accountant, brings over 2 decades of rich experience spanning early-stage startups to public companies including Scaler, SugarBox, Zee Group and Devyani International. Tapan has been a part of CarDekho Group in the past where he supported the leadership in strategic planning, fundraising and financial transformation of the company, commending the role of Director- Finance. Talking about the appointment, Ruchir Arora, Founder & CEO, CollegeDekho, said, “We are excited to welcome Tapan on board. His enriching experience of running an education venture, and scaling startups and ed-techs will help us unlock the next stage of growth for CollegeDekho. His experience in scaling platforms and building robust financial frameworks will be instrumental in accelerating CollegeDekho’s mission as we democratize access to quality education, guidance, and skilling for students across the country.” Tapan Jindal, Chief Financial Officer, CollegeDekho, said, “Education has been close to my heart, and having run an education venture early in my career, I feel CollegeDekho is the place for me and being back in CarDekho Group is like coming back to home. I look forward to creating long term value for stakeholders and strengthening the financial and governance practices as we work towards contributing to the education sector in India via making education accessible to so many.”

title: Nissan names Gagan Mangal as Head of Communications for India
text: Gurugram: Nissan Motor India Pvt. Ltd. (NMIPL) has announced the appointment of Gagan Mangal as Head of Communications, effective 12 January 2026. Based in Gurugram, Mangal will lead all communications for NMIPL, reporting to Katherine Zachary, Vice President – International Communications, and working closely with Saurabh Vatsa, Managing Director, NMIPL. Announcing the appointment, Saurabh Vatsa, Managing Director, Nissan Motor India, said, “We are pleased to welcome Gagan to Nissan Motor India at a pivotal time in our journey. He brings deep automotive communications expertise and a strong understanding of the Indian media landscape. As we accelerate our brand resurgence and prepare for exciting product launches, Gagan’s leadership will be instrumental in strengthening our communications strategy and building a compelling Nissan narrative in India.” Mangal joins Nissan from Volkswagen India, where he was heading Press and Marketing Communications. A management graduate with over 18 years of experience, he has worked extensively across corporate communications and marketing, with prior roles at leading automotive OEMs including Volkswagen and Hyundai. Across his career, Mangal has driven integrated communications strategies spanning product launches, large-scale events, brand positioning, and campaigns. He has also been instrumental in shaping media narratives and managing strong relationships with national and regional media. Speaking on his appointment, Gagan Mangal, Head of Communications, Nissan Motor India, said, “I am truly excited to join Nissan Motor India at this pivotal moment in its growth and transformation journey. India remains a priority market for Nissan, with significant opportunities to strengthen brand relevance, trust, and customer connection. I look forward to collaborating closely with teams across India and globally to craft a clear, confident, and customer-centric narrative one that reflects Nissan’s global ambitions while resonating authentically with audiences in India.” Commenting on the leadership move, Katherine Zachary, Vice President – International Communications, said, “Gagan brings deep automotive communications expertise and a strong understanding of the Indian media landscape. We are confident his leadership will be instrumental as Nissan enters an exciting new phase in India.” In his new role, Mangal will play a key role in supporting Nissan’s brand resurgence in India, strengthening communications strategy, media engagement, and upcoming product launches as the company enters its next phase of growth.

title: Gaurav Laghate to Lead Corporate Brand and PR as SPNI Enters Next Growth Phase
text: Mumbai: Sony Pictures Networks India (SPNI) has announced a leadership realignment as part of its refreshed operating model, reinforcing its strategy to operate as a content-first, platform-agnostic and multi-lingual entertainment company. As part of this reorganisation, Gaurav Laghate has taken charge as Head – Corporate Brand, PR and Corporate Communications. In his expanded role, Laghate will lead the company’s external relations mandate, overseeing corporate brand positioning, media relations, reputation management and strategic communications across stakeholders. The appointment aligns SPNI’s communications function with its evolving business priorities, as the network sharpens integration across television and digital platforms. Laghate’s mandate will be critical in shaping a unified corporate narrative, strengthening brand trust, and ensuring consistent messaging across consumer, industry and institutional audiences. With corporate communications elevated as a strategic function, SPNI is signalling the importance of reputation, clarity and brand purpose as it navigates its next phase of growth in a rapidly converging media landscape.

title: Coach Names Arjoon Bose Vice President of Marketing for EMEA & India
text: New York: Luxury fashion brand Coach has appointed Arjoon Bose as Vice President, Marketing for Europe, the Middle East, Africa and India, strengthening its leadership bench as it sharpens focus on brand building across key international markets. In his new role, Bose will be responsible for shaping and executing Coach’s marketing strategy across the EMEA region and India, with an emphasis on driving global brand momentum and connecting the heritage label with a new generation of consumers. Bose announced his move on LinkedIn, calling it a transition into the world of fashion and retail. He said he looks forward to working with Coach’s teams to reimagine the brand’s legacy—often described as “America’s Original House of Leather”—through creativity, craftsmanship and self-expression, inspired by the spirit of New York. Prior to joining Coach, Bose served as Global Chief Marketing & Digital Officer at Bel, where he led large-scale brand and digital transformation initiatives across multiple international markets. Before that, he spent nearly nine years at General Mills, rising to the role of International Head of Creative & Growth Ideas and overseeing regions spanning Europe, Australia, Asia and Latin America. He began his professional career at L’Oréal, spending a decade building deep expertise in brand marketing and leadership—experience that now underpins his transition into global luxury retail. The appointment comes as Coach continues to invest in strengthening its global brand presence, blending its heritage positioning with contemporary storytelling across fashion-forward and high-growth markets.

title: Flipkart appoints Jane Duke as Chief Ethics & Compliance Officer
text: Bengaluru: Flipkart has announced the appointment of Jane Duke as Chief Ethics & Compliance Officer (CECO) for the Flipkart Group. In her new role, Jane will lead the Group’s Ethics & Compliance function and will be a key partner to the Flipkart leadership team. The appointment reflects Flipkart’s focus on strengthening leadership and governance capabilities in line with its evolving scale and long-term growth ambitions. Jane brings nearly three decades of experience across public-sector enforcement and enterprise-level compliance leadership. She joins Flipkart from Tyson Foods, where she served as Vice President and Associate General Counsel and earlier as Chief Compliance Officer, leading matters spanning regulatory compliance and enforcement, government investigations, employment and commercial litigation, business legal support, and enterprise risk management. Earlier in her career, Jane spent over a decade with the U.S. Attorney’s Office for the Eastern District of Arkansas, including serving as U.S. Attorney from 2007 to 2011. Kalyan Krishnamurthy, Chief Executive Officer, Flipkart Group, said, “We are pleased to welcome Jane to Flipkart. Her extensive experience across ethics, compliance, and governance in complex, global organisations will add significant value in reinforcing our commitment to transparency and ethical business practices. Jane’s leadership will play a critical role in supporting sustainable, long-term value creation for all stakeholders. As we continue to scale, building strong institutional foundations and a culture of integrity is central to how we create long-term value.” Jane Duke, Chief Ethics & Compliance Officer, Flipkart Group, said, “I am excited to join Flipkart at an important stage of its journey. I look forward to working closely with the leadership team to further strengthen robust, transparent, scalable, and technology-enabled ethics and compliance practices that support the company’s long-term growth ambitions and evolving responsibilities as a global digital commerce leader.”

title: CleanStart appoints Anil Dhoot as Country Manager for India and SAARC
text: Mumbai: CleanStart, a global software supply chain security company, has announced the appointment of Anil Dhoot as Country Manager for India and the SAARC region. In his new role, Dhoot will lead CleanStart’s regional business operations, focusing on strengthening market presence, expanding customer engagement, and accelerating long-term growth across key enterprise segments. Dhoot brings over two decades of experience in cybersecurity and enterprise technology sales. He has held senior leadership positions at global cybersecurity firms, including Trend Micro, where he led enterprise business segments and managed strategic customer relationships across multiple markets. Over the course of his career, he has built and scaled high-performing sales teams, driven regional expansion, and worked closely with large enterprises in complex and regulated environments. As Country Manager for India and SAARC, Dhoot will oversee CleanStart’s market execution across the region, with a strong focus on establishing on-ground leadership and supporting the company’s long-term priorities in software supply chain security. Commenting on the appointment, Vijendra Katiyar, Co-founder and Chief Revenue Officer, CleanStart, said, “India and the SAARC region represent a significant growth opportunity for CleanStart. Anil’s appointment underscores our decision to invest decisively in regional leadership and long-term expansion across these markets.” Speaking on his new role, Anil Dhoot said, “The next wave of technology growth in India and the SAARC region will be defined not just by speed, but by trust. Software supply chain security will play a foundational role in that journey. As Country Manager, I look forward to working closely with customers and partners across the region to help organizations build secure, verifiable software at scale with CleanStart.” In his role, Dhoot will work closely with customers, partners, and the broader ecosystem to expand CleanStart’s footprint across India and the SAARC markets, while ensuring the company’s offerings align with regional business needs and regulatory requirements.

title: boAt promotes Sammyak Jain to Business Head – International Business
text: Mumbai: boAt, an audio and wearables brand, has announced the elevation of Sammyak Jain to the role of Business Head – International Business, as the company sharpens its focus on accelerating growth across global markets. In his expanded role, Sammyak will lead boAt’s international business strategy, driving market entry and expansion, forging value-led partnerships, and building scalable and sustainable operating models across priority geographies. The move reflects boAt’s ambition to take its India-born brand to audiences worldwide. Sammyak has been a key member of boAt’s leadership team since 2022 and currently also heads Enterprise & ODM Sales. In addition, he leads Strategy & Operations, where he has played a pivotal role in shaping the company’s growth roadmap. His elevation underlines boAt’s confidence in his ability to translate its domestic success into a strong global footprint. Prior to joining boAt, Sammyak spent close to six years at Bain & Company, progressing from Associate Consultant to Senior Manager, advising leading Indian and global organisations on growth strategy and operational transformation. His earlier experience also includes stints with Rocket Internet, along with internships at Kearney and Deloitte. Sammyak holds a B.Tech from IIT Delhi and an MBA from IIM Calcutta. Commenting on the company’s international expansion, Gaurav Nayya, CEO, boAt said, “Global expansion is central to boAt’s long-term growth strategy. boAt’s journey beyond India is accelerating, with several international markets now becoming meaningful growth drivers. This elevation is part of our effort to strengthen leadership and sharpen our global execution.” Sharing his perspective on the elevation, Sammyak Jain said, “This is an exciting moment for boAt as we take our India-born brand to the world. I’m grateful for the trust placed in me and look forward to building high-impact international businesses that stay true to boAt’s bold, consumer-first DNA.”

title: Schaeffler appoints Maximilian Fiedler as Regional Chief Executive Officer Asia/Pacific
text: Chennai: Schaeffler, a motion technology company, announced the appointment of Maximilian Fiedler (38) as Regional CEO, Asia/Pacific, effective 1 January 2026. In this role, he will also be part of the Executive Board of Schaeffler Group, representing the region. Fiedler has been serving as the Chief Financial Officer, Region Asia/Pacific, since 2022. In June 2025, Maximilian Fiedler assumed the position as Regional CEO Asia/Pacific on a temporary basis in addition to his role as CFO Asia/Pacific. Fiedler has been with Schaeffler since 2012 and has held several senior leadership roles, including Head of External Reporting for Schaeffler Group and Chief Financial Officer for Schaeffler Mexico. Before joining Schaeffler, Mr. Fiedler was Treasury Manager for HeidelbergCement AG. Klaus Rosenfeld, CEO of Schaeffler AG, said, “We are delighted to appoint Maximilian to drive our business in the Asia Pacific region. Maximilian has continuously demonstrated exceptional commitment to Schaeffler. We are confident, he will continue to inspire and steer our company towards sustained success.” Maximilian Fiedler, Regional CEO Asia/Pacific, said, “I am honored to be entrusted with this position, and I look forward to working with our talented team to build on our achievements in the region, drive deeper engagement with our customers and deliver lasting value to all our stakeholders.”

title: GRB Ghee brand Founder G. R. Balasubramaniam conferred ‘Outstanding Dairy Professional Award, 2025’
text: Bengaluru: G. R. Balasubramaniam, Founder, Chairman and Managing Director of GRB Dairy Foods Private Limited, has been conferred the Outstanding Dairy Professional Award, 2025 by the Indian Dairy Association (IDA), South Zone, recognising his transformational leadership and lasting contribution to the evolution of India’s modern dairy industry. The award honours Balasubramaniam’s pivotal role in building GRB Dairy Foods into one of India’s most trusted dairy brands. Over a career spanning more than five decades, his leadership has set benchmarks in quality, integrity, and consumer confidence, firmly establishing GRB as a symbol of purity and trust across Indian and global markets. Widely regarded as a pioneer in the sector, Balasubramaniam has successfully blended traditional dairy practices with modern enterprise systems, creating a resilient and future-ready organisation. His vision has not only enabled GRB’s sustained growth but has also influenced best practices across the broader dairy ecosystem. The Outstanding Dairy Professional Award is presented to industry leaders who demonstrate sustained excellence, entrepreneurial foresight, and significant sector-wide impact. Based on recommendations from state chapters, Balasubramaniam was selected from Karnataka for his long-standing commitment to professional excellence, ethical leadership, and industry stewardship. The award was presented at the Southern Dairy and Food Conclave 2026, held at the Calicut Trade Centre in Kozhikode, Kerala. The conclave, themed “Transforming Dairy and Food Systems for Global Health”, brought together policymakers, industry leaders, academicians, and professionals to discuss the future of food and nutrition systems. Balasubramaniam continues to be recognised as a visionary leader whose values-driven approach has helped shape direction, discipline, and aspiration within India’s dairy sector.

title: Dina Powell McCormick Takes on Top Leadership Role at Meta
text: Mumbai: Meta has appointed Dina Powell McCormick as its new President and Vice Chairman, strengthening its leadership bench as the company accelerates investments in artificial intelligence, infrastructure, and long-term capital strategy. McCormick, who has been serving on Meta’s Board of Directors, will now join the company’s management team, playing a central role in shaping Meta’s corporate strategy and operational execution. Her appointment comes at a time when the tech giant is committing multi-billion-dollar capital to computing infrastructure and advanced AI systems, including its push toward personal superintelligence. In her new role, McCormick will work closely with Meta’s compute and infrastructure leadership to ensure these large-scale investments are aligned with the company’s long-term objectives while also delivering economic benefits in markets where Meta operates. She will also spearhead the development of new strategic capital partnerships and explore innovative funding models to expand Meta’s investment capacity over the coming years. Announcing the appointment, Meta Founder and CEO Mark Zuckerberg highlighted McCormick’s global experience and financial leadership. He said her background in international finance and her relationships across governments and capital markets make her particularly well suited to help Meta navigate its next stage of growth. McCormick brings more than 25 years of experience across global finance, public policy, and economic development. She spent 16 years at Goldman Sachs, where she was a partner and a member of the firm’s Management Committee, and led its Global Sovereign Investment Banking business. During her tenure, she played a key role in launching and scaling major economic development platforms such as 10,000 Women, 10,000 Small Businesses, and One Million Black Women—initiatives designed to expand access to capital and drive long-term economic opportunity. Beyond Wall Street, McCormick has held senior roles in the US government, serving two presidents. She was Deputy National Security Advisor under President Donald J. Trump and earlier worked as a Senior White House Advisor and Assistant Secretary of State under President George W. Bush, reporting to then Secretary of State Condoleezza Rice. Prior to joining Meta full-time, she was Vice Chair, President, and Head of Global Client Services at BDT & MSD Partners, a merchant bank that advises family-owned and founder-led businesses. With McCormick moving into a top leadership role, Meta is signaling that its next chapter will be defined not just by product innovation, but by financial scale, global partnerships, and the long-term capital strategy needed to support the company’s rapidly expanding AI ambitions.

title: Jasmine Aikey wins top college soccer honor
text: Senior forward Jasmine Aikey was awarded the 2025 Missouri Athletic Club Hermann Trophy on Friday – the most coveted individual honor in NCAA Division I soccer. Aikey is the sixth Cardinal to win the award, which has been presented annually to the National Player of the Year since 1967, while the selection is Stanford’s seventh overall. Including Aikey, a Cardinal player has claimed four of the last nine MAC Hermann Trophies, with Andi Sullivan earning the award in 2017, followed by Catarina Macario becoming a back-to-back winner in 2018 and 2019. Kelley O’Hara was the first Stanford player to win the MAC Hermann Trophy at the conclusion of the 2009 season. O’Hara was followed by Christen Press (2010) and Teresa Noyola (2011). “Winning the Hermann Trophy is an incredible accomplishment,” said the Knowles Family Director of Women’s Soccer Paul Ratcliffe . “I am so happy that Jasmine’s hard work and dedication paid off, as she is one of the most talented and competitive student-athletes I have ever coached. This past season, Jasmine helped lead our team to the College Cup Final while scoring some remarkable goals and proving to be a dominant player throughout the year. Jasmine is an outstanding scholar-athlete and has had an incredible career at Stanford in the classroom and on the field.” Aikey, who signed a professional contract with the NWSL’s Denver Summit FC earlier this week, is one of four finalists for the Honda Sport Award for Soccer and was named the Academic All-America® Team Member of the Year for Division I after leading Stanford to a national championship berth and a third consecutive College Cup appearance this season. With the selection on Friday, Aikey becomes just the second player in history to take home the Hermann Trophy and be named Academic All-America® Team Member of the Year – joining Portland’s Christine Sinclair who managed the feat in 2005. The 2025 TopDrawerSoccer Player of the Year and a United Soccer Coaches All-America first-team selection, Aikey led the Cardinal with 53 points and an ACC-best 21 goals, while tallying 11 assists and seven game-winners. She also led Division I in points, ranked second nationally in game-winning goals, and finished third in goals. The All-ACC first-team selection tallied at least one point in 20 of her 25 matches this year, and had at least one goal in 16 of the 25 contests to go along with five multi-goal games. Aikey’s 21 goals ranked tied for fourth in a single season in program history, while her 53 points ranked fifth. Her point total is also the most by an ACC player since North Carolina’s Casey Nogueira registered 58 in 2008. The ACC accounted for all three finalists on Friday, as Florida State junior forward Jordynn Dudley and University of Notre Dame sophomore forward Izzy Engle joined Aikey on the stage. This story was originally published by Stanford Athletics.

title: Five thrilling Stanford Athletics moments from 2025
text: ESPN2 / ACC Network In January, Jaylen Blakes scored the game-winning shot  for men’s basketball against North Carolina with less than two seconds left to play in the 72-71 nailbiter. Blakes scored 20 points with a game-high seven assists. ESPN2 / ACC Network Junior Juliette Dhalluin’s clutch goal was one of many amazing moments for the women’s water polo team that led to their 10th NCAA  title this year. Dhalluin led the offense in the team’s win against USC with a hat trick and was one of four players with multiple goals. ESPN2 / ACC Network In the women’s soccer team’s 5-1 win over USC  in September, sophomore Eleanor Klinger scored twice in a six-minute span. Klinger’s second goal came on a shot unleashed from the Big Ten logo along the far sideline. ESPN2 / ACC Network Senior CJ Williams was the Cardinal’s leading receiver with 76 yards, including a 34-yard touchdown, during Stanford’s epic 31-10 win over Cal  in the 128th Big Game in November. It was the Cardinal’s first win in the rivalry since 2020. ESPN2 / ACC Network In this instant classic, Stanford football general manager Andrew Luck stopped mid-interview and cheered on as junior Jay Green picked up a fumble and returned it 49 yards for a touchdown against Cal during the Big Game.

title: Blume Earthquake Engineering Center
text: 2025 marks the 50th Anniversary of  the Blume Earthquake Engineering Center! For the past 50 years, the John A. Blume Earthquake Engineering Center at Stanford University has been devoted to the advancement of research, education and practice in earthquake engineering. The Blume Center, part of the Department of Civil and Environmental Engineering, has a strong commitment to serve the profession and the community in reducing earthquake risk. Through its activities, the Blume Center contributes to the understanding of earthquakes and their effects on structures. These activities include research, instruction, publication of reports and articles, and sponsorship of seminars and conferences. See the Event Page for more information, photos and videos. title: Le Venezuela : un gros caillou dans la chaussure de Xi Jinping
text: La capture par les États-Unis du président Nicolás Maduro samedi 3 janvier porte dans l’immédiat un coup dur pour la Chine, prise en totale surprise et pour qui le Venezuela était un allié majeur en Amérique Latine. A plus long terme, l’aventure est risquée pour Washington que Pékin ne manquera pas de diaboliser pour dénoncer un nouvel impérialisme américain. Manifestement la Chine ne savait rien jusqu’au dernier moment de ce coup de force de l’administration Trump, une réalité qui, selon plusieurs analystes et experts, est d’autant plus gênante qu’elle semble trahir l’inefficacité des installations de détection électronique et des radars sophistiqués que Pékin avait installés au Venezuela d’où Pékin souhaitait espionner les États-Unis dont les côtes ne sont qu’à quelque 2 000 kilomètres. La deuxième évidence est que l’opération américaine porte un coup dur tant sur le plan économique que géopolitique à la Chine pour qui le Venezuela était devenu à la fois un partenaire clé où elle avait lourdement investi et un avant-poste majeur pour consolider son emprise croissante sur l’Amérique latine. Depuis des années, le Venezuela avait servi de vitrine pour les exportations militaires chinoises en Amérique latine. Sa défense aérienne s’appuyait sur des systèmes radar fabriqués par le China Electronics Technology Group (CETC), dont le radar de surveillance longue portée JYL-1 et le radar à ondes métriques JY-27 qualifié de « tueur furtif , » présentés comme capables de détecter des avions furtifs tels que les F-22 et F-35 américains à des centaines de kilomètres de distance et de guider des missiles S-300 de fabrication russe pour les intercepter et les détruire. Les unités marines du pays sont quant à elles équipées de véhicules blindés amphibies VN-16 et VN-18, de plateformes mécanisées et des systèmes de lancement multiple de roquettes SR-5, tous de fabrication chinoise. Ces matériels avaient permis au Venezuela de revendiquer l’une des forces amphibies les plus avancées de l’Amérique latine. Or il apparaît aujourd’hui que l’ensemble de la chaîne de commandement vénézuélienne s’est effondré très rapidement. Non seulement aucune alerte n’a semble-t-il été donnée à temps, mais nombre d’installations militaires vénézuéliennes ont été détruites sans aucune réaction tangible de l’armée. Ce fiasco militaire sera certainement dûment analysé par les partenaires de la Chine, devenue le quatrième vendeur d’armes dans le monde, ainsi que par ses rivaux, dont en première ligne les États-Unis et, bien sûr, Taïwan qui vit sous la menace constante d’une invasion comme l’ont démontré les dernières manœuvres chinoises fin décembre 2025. Un fiasco pour le matériel militaire chinois Dès le début des opérations américaines, aux premières heures du 3 janvier, les systèmes de détection chinois se sont révélés inefficaces. Selon des sources américaines, les installations radar ont été aveuglées lors de la première vague de guerre électronique, tandis que les forces terrestres vénézuéliennes, qui manquaient de couverture aérienne, ont été rapidement neutralisées avant même de pouvoir se déployer. L’opération a abouti à l’arrestation rapide et spectaculaire du dictateur vénézuélien Nicolás Maduro et de son épouse Cilia Flores. Le couple doit être...

title: 200 hours of silence: Reporting from inside Iran - The Korea Times
text: A citizen sits helplessly on a Tehran street shrouded in tear gas, facing dozens of heavily armed riot police on motorcycles, Jan. 16, in this photo provided by local activists in Iran. Courtesy of AsiaN This dispatch was filed by Alireza Bahrami, an Iranian journalist, for AsiaN — the official news platform of the Asia Journalist Association (AJA). — ED. TEHRAN — After more than 200 hours of losing all access to the international internet, I am writing to the audience of AsiaN and the Asia Journalist Association (AJA) at the first opportunity of limited connectivity. Why? For three reasons. First, I have a moral obligation to AsiaN and AJA, and I must fulfill my duty as a journalist at all times. Second, as a journalist, I have a responsibility to convey the most accurate account of the situation I am in to people around the world — even if doing so is dangerous for me. Third, the last time I told the editor that I would send the article that night or the following morning, I lost access a few hours later and was unable to send any text. That situation lasted for 10 days. This could happen again. Therefore, I must use this opportunity immediately. Experience has shown that writing an analytical article requires careful consideration of all aspects. That is why I initially asked the editor for 48 hours and later requested a little longer. For this reason, what you are reading now is a more detailed analysis. I am certain that the situation in Iran may appear more heated in your minds than it is in reality. This is often the case. Those who follow events from afar through media coverage tend to see a slightly exaggerated version of reality. In this instance, when all communication was cut off and the media sometimes published their own assumptions, the magnification was even greater. That said, I personally experienced moments in my own city that I sincerely hope you will never have to face. I will now try to present an almost accurate and complete narrative. To do so, we must go back a little. When Mohammad Khatami, the founder of the “Dialogue of Civilizations,” became president in 1997, Iran’s international position was improving. However, when Mahmoud Ahmadinejad, a right-wing politician, was elected president in 2005, conditions deteriorated. When Barack Obama signed the Joint Comprehensive Plan of Action with Iran in 2015, the situation improved. However, when Republican Donald Trump was elected president of the United States, conditions worsened once again. In 2024, Masoud Pezeshkian became president of Iran in an effort to prevent war. Nevertheless, in 2025, Israel ultimately attacked Iran. Whenever Iran’s political relations in the international arena improved, the economic conditions and welfare of the Iranian people also improved. Conversely, whenever Iran’s global political situation became more confrontational, the economic conditions and welfare of the people declined.
